definition: commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)

sentences.english: VICTIM】They were the victims of a dishonest merchant.
sentences.chinese: 他们是一个奸商的受害者。
他们将被称为投机者和奸商。

sentences.english: You are a shark of the first order, Euripides. So much the better for the firm!
sentences.chinese: 你可算得是第一流的奸商，这也是咱公司的造化。

sentences.english: Dishonest tradesmen used to fob off inferior goods on the customers.
sentences.chinese: 过去奸商常以次货欺骗顾客。

sentences.english: This law is intended to prevent dishonest people from palming off inferior goods.
sentences.chinese: 这个法律就是用来制止奸商以欺骗手段出售劣货。

sentences.english: The dishonest trader tried to plant a faked picture on me.
sentences.chinese: 奸商企图把一幅假画卖给我。

sentences.english: While millions were fighting and dying, the profiteers were lining their pockets.
sentences.chinese: 数百万人在打仗捐躯，而奸商们却趁机发不义之财。

sentences.english: I feel like a war-time profiteer.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己就像一个战时的奸商。

sentences.english: This guy while too grew aggravate, have to pedal the breeze untruthful trader infection floor.
sentences.chinese: 这家伙什么时候也变坏了，一定是被风奸商传染地。

sentences.english: There is no evidence that the broker was in league with the fraudulent vendor.
sentences.chinese: 没有代理人和奸商相勾结的证据。

sentences.english: Beware of dishonest traders in the tourist areas.
sentences.chinese: 在旅游区一定要谨防奸商。

sentences.english: Nice to meet you, I represents Profiteer company.
Will give them the money and technology just to keep the War profiteers gong.
sentences.chinese: 给他们资金和技术以使战争奸商发财吗？

sentences.english: They become “profiteers” in the eyes of those hurt by rising prices.
sentences.chinese: 在涨价受害者眼里，商人变成了牟取暴利的奸商。

definition: ruthless and lacking in conscience/vicious mind full of hatred and jealousy/black core (flaw in pottery)
to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
to seek nothing but profit (idiom); personal profit before everything/self-seeking
variant of 唯利是圖|唯利是图[wei2 li4 shi4 tu2]
to be greedy in getting money
to press (fruit)/variant of 敲詐|敲诈[qiao1 zha4]
speculation and profiteering (idiom); buying and selling on speculation
